content: perhaps, not every problem needs to be solved with neural nets. Random forests (one example) are usually faster, can rank features, and the model’s logic can be explained to the board of directors. This is also machine learning. imo, none of it makes any sense without feature engineering which can take months and involves humans with advanced domain knowledge. no doubt, the world is complicated and (thankfully) we have multiple tools to describe it. Thanks for the fun article :)
